description: A simple address with a dot separator
A hyphen is allowed in the domain
A forward slash is allowed in the local-part
The local-part can end in a hyphen
A simple address with a dot separator
An email address with a subdomain is valid
A hyphen is allowed in specific parts of the domain
The underscore character is allowed in the local-part
A hyphen is allowed in the local-part
A domain under 256 characters is allowed
A local-part under 65 characters is allowed
The domain can start with a number
The domain can have a fully numerical part
The domain can have parts of length of 63 characters or less
The local-part can have a length of 64 characters or less
An address with sub-addressing in the local-part is valid
Unusual characters / and = are allowed in the local-part
Unusual character $ is allowed in the local-part
Unusual characters ! and % are allowed in the local-part
The local-part can start with an underscore
An address with a punycode domain is valid
An empty IPv6 domain is valid
A single + character is a valid local-part
Unusual character * is allowed in the local-part
Unusual character ~ is allowed in the local-part
Unusual characters { } are allowed in the local-part
An all-numeric domain (except for the TLD) is valid
Simple valid address with unique TLD
A valid local-part only needs at least one character
The plus symbol is a valid local-part
A basic address with a valid comment and escaped at-sign
A basic address with a valid comment
Comments in the domain are allowed
A comment with an escaped ) character is allowed

File format: email-to-test:
first(Welcome to
 the ("wonderful" (!)) world
 of email)@test.org
expected-local-part:
first(Welcome to
 the ("wonderful" (!)) world
 of email)
description: A very complicated address with comments that is valid
A comment with whitespace is allowed
A comment with an escaped ( character is allowed
Multiple levels of nested comments are allowed
Characters ' and . are allowed within comments
The - character is allowed within a domain part
Underscore is allowed in the local-part
The ~ character is a valid local-part
Comments in the domain are allowed
A combination of unicode local-parts and domains are allowed
A combination of unicode local-parts and domains are allowed
A combination of unicode local-parts and domains are allowed
A combination of unicode local-parts and domains are allowed
A combination of unicode local-parts and domains are allowed
Comments are allowed between dot-separated domain parts
Comments are allowed inside the local-part if dot-separated
The " character is allowed within comments
The " character is allowed within dot-separated comments
Comments do not count against the length of the domain
The % and ! symbols are valid in the local-part
Whitespace is allowed when quoted or between parts
The backslash \ character is allowed when escaped
Angled bracket is allowed when quoted
A simple valid address with unusual characters
An identifier can start with a dot
